\sphinxstepscope


\chapter{Real\sphinxhyphen{}Time Camera Pose Estimator}
\label{\detokenize{introduction:real-time-camera-pose-estimator}}\label{\detokenize{introduction::doc}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This program provides a solution for estimating the 6\sphinxhyphen{}DoF (Degrees of Freedom) camera pose, which includes position and orientation relative to a global coordinate system defined by a chessboard pattern. It operates in \sphinxstylestrong{real\sphinxhyphen{}time}.

\sphinxAtStartPar
—


\section{Prerequisites}
\label{\detokenize{introduction:prerequisites}}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{\sphinxstylestrong{Hardware Requirements}}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Camera:} Basler camera.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Chessboard Pattern:} A printed or projected chessboard pattern with known dimensions.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{\sphinxstylestrong{Software Requirements}}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Pylon SDK:} Required for connecting the camera to the computer.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Download it here: \sphinxhref{https://www.baslerweb.com/en/software/pylon/}{Pylon Viewer}.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}

\sphinxAtStartPar
—


\section{Installation}
\label{\detokenize{introduction:installation}}\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Clone the repository by using git clone with the repository link.
.. code\sphinxhyphen{}block:: bash
\begin{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
git clone \sphinxurl{https://github.com/YunhyeokHan/PoseEstimator.git}
\end{quote}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
(Optional) Create a Python 3.9 environment by using conda create command with the name \sphinxtitleref{PoseEstimator} and Python version \sphinxtitleref{3.9}.
.. code\sphinxhyphen{}block:: bash
\begin{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
conda create \textendash{}name PoseEstimator python=3.9
\end{quote}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Install the required Python libraries by using pip install with the \sphinxtitleref{requirements.txt} file.
.. code\sphinxhyphen{}block:: bash
\begin{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
pip install \sphinxhyphen{}r requirements.txt
\end{quote}

\end{enumerate}

\sphinxAtStartPar
—


\section{Usage}
\label{\detokenize{introduction:usage}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Camera Calibration}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Before running the pose estimation, the camera must be calibrated using a chessboard pattern.
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Start the calibration process by running the camera calibrator script and providing arguments for the checkerboard dimensions, square size, and exposure time.
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Define the number of corner points in the rows and columns of the pattern (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}\sphinxhyphen{}checkerboard \textless{}rows\textgreater{} \textless{}columns\textgreater{}}}).

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Square size: Specify the size of each square on the chessboard in millimeters (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}\sphinxhyphen{}square\_size \textless{}size\textgreater{}}}).

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Exposure time: Set the camera exposure time in microseconds (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}\sphinxhyphen{}exposure\_time \textless{}value\textgreater{}}}).

\end{itemize}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
python\PYG{+w}{ }PoseEstimator/camera\PYGZus{}calibrator.py\PYG{+w}{ }\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}checkerboard\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{l+m}{7}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{l+m}{5}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}square\PYGZus{}size\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{l+m}{10}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}exposure\PYGZus{}time\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{l+m}{20000}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Place the chessboard in the camera’s view and verify that all corner points are detected. The program will display real\sphinxhyphen{}time feedback.

\noindent{\hspace*{\fill}\sphinxincludegraphics[width=1200\sphinxpxdimen]{{image_0}.png}\hspace*{\fill}}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Press Spacebar to save detected points for calibration. Move the chessboard to different positions and orientations, capturing sufficient data points.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Press ESC to end the capture session. The program will perform intrinsic camera calibration and save the results for future use.

\end{enumerate}

\sphinxAtStartPar
—

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Pose Estimation}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Once the camera is calibrated, you can run the pose estimation program.
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Start the pose estimator by running the pose estimation script with the same arguments as the calibration process.
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Number of corner points in the rows and columns of the pattern (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}\sphinxhyphen{}checkerboard \textless{}rows\textgreater{} \textless{}columns\textgreater{}}}).

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Square size: Specify the size of each square on the chessboard in millimeters (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}\sphinxhyphen{}square\_size \textless{}size\textgreater{}}}).

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Exposure time: Set the camera exposure time in microseconds (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}\sphinxhyphen{}exposure\_time \textless{}value\textgreater{}}}).

\end{itemize}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
python\PYG{+w}{ }PoseEstimator/pose\PYGZus{}estimator.py\PYG{+w}{ }\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}checkerboard\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{l+m}{7}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{l+m}{5}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}square\PYGZus{}size\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{l+m}{10}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}exposure\PYGZus{}time\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{l+m}{20000}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
The program will display real\sphinxhyphen{}time camera feed and calculate the 6\sphinxhyphen{}DoF pose relative to the chessboard pattern. Ensure that the pattern is visible to the camera and its corners are detected. Position/orientation of camera is defined with respect to Global XYZ axis of chessboard pattern (XYZ axes are depicted as R G B in the image).

\noindent{\hspace*{\fill}\sphinxincludegraphics[width=1200\sphinxpxdimen]{{pose_estimation}.png}\hspace*{\fill}}

\noindent{\hspace*{\fill}\sphinxincludegraphics[width=1200\sphinxpxdimen]{{pose_estimation_plot}.png}\hspace*{\fill}}

\end{enumerate}
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\setcounter{enumi}{4}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Press ESC to terminate the program.

\end{enumerate}

\sphinxAtStartPar
—


\section{Notes}
\label{\detokenize{introduction:notes}}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Calibration results are saved automatically and reused for pose estimation.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Ensure the chessboard pattern dimensions and exposure settings are correctly provided in all steps for accurate results.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
For real\sphinxhyphen{}time performance, use a compatible camera and a well\sphinxhyphen{}lit environment.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxstepscope


\chapter{PoseEstimator}
\label{\detokenize{modules:poseestimator}}\label{\detokenize{modules::doc}}
\sphinxstepscope

\index{load\_calibration\_data() (in module PoseEstimator.pose\_estimator)@\spxentry{load\_calibration\_data()}\spxextra{in module PoseEstimator.pose\_estimator}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{PoseEstimator:PoseEstimator.pose_estimator.load_calibration_data}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PoseEstimator.pose\_estimator.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{load\_calibration\_data}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{filepath}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{img\_size}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Load calibration data from a file and compute the new camera matrix.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{filepath}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} Path to the calibration data file.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Calibration data containing mtx, dist, mapx, mapy.

\sphinxAtStartPar

\end{description}\end{quote}
